titles: The declaration and address of the gentry of the county of Essex, who have adhered to the King, and suffered imprisonment, or sequestration, during the late troubles.
publisher: Printed for Gabriel Bedell, and Thomas Collins, at the middle Temple-gate in Fleetstreet,
notes: "A letter dated Chelmsford, April 17, enclosing the declaration and hoping for peace. A declaration that they entertain no thought of revenge and submit to the resolution of the next Parliament for a settlement of Church and State." -- Cf. Steele.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Albemarle, George Monck, --  Duke of, 1608-1670 --  Early works to 1800.
